entry.title: Distinguishing secant from cactus varieties
entry.summary:
In this paper we study homogeneous polynomials and vector subspaces of a polynomial ring that are divisible by a large power of a linear form. We compute their cactus and border cactus ranks. We show that for $d\geq 5$, the component of the cactus variety $\kappa_{14}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^6))$ other than the secant variety $\sigma_{14}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^6))$ consists of degree $d$ polynomials divisible by $(d-3)$-th power of a linear form. For $d\geq 6$ we present an algorithm for deciding whether a point in the cactus variety $\kappa_{14}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^6))$ belongs to the secant variety $\sigma_{14}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^6))$. Analogously, we show that for $d\geq 5$, the component of the Grassmann cactus variety $\kappa_{8,3}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^4))$ other than the Grassmann secant variety $\sigma_{8,3}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^4))$ consists of subspaces divisible by $(d-2)$-th power of a linear form. Finally, for $d\geq 5$ we present an algorithm for deciding whether a point in the Grassmann cactus variety $\kappa_{8,3}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^4))$ belongs to the Grassmann secant variety $\sigma_{8,3}(
u_d(\mathbb{P}^4))$.
